page.title: 18Recent Events in the Cowtons
page.content: A flower festival was held in June at St Marys Church, South Cowton. During the same weekend, a brass band played at the Sunday Gift Day Service. Both villages hold annual sports days in the summer. There are races for the children, and a fancy dress parade for young and old. These days usually end with a disco in the village hall. A strawberry fayre was held in July as a money raising effort for the Methodist Chapel. The Nursery 'Fun Run' is a 3 mile race around N Cowton with competitors being sponsored and proceeds going to the Nursery funds. A 'Magical Evening' was held in North Cowton, and another music night in East Cowton village hall. A recent famous visitor to East Cowton was the former Home Secretary, Leon Britton, who is the local Member of Parliament.
